channel.title: Times of India Tech: Latest IT, telecom, Internet, BPO news and updates
channel.description: Visit Times of india Tech for everything about IT jobs, gadgets, Web 2.0 apps, blogs, social networking, wireless platforms like 3G, WiFi, VOIP; and updates on outsourcing to India

image.title: Times of India Tech: Latest IT, telecom, Internet, BPO news and updates

item.title: Reliance Globalcom no longer up for sale
item.description: Reliance Globalcom is no longer up for sale and may raise debt or equity to fund its expansion plans, Globalcom's new CEO said.

item.title: Samsung accuses Apple of leaking confidential documents
item.description: Samsung has claimed that Apple leaked confidential information about the company in a licensing row.

item.title: Hackers can attack your PC even without internet
item.description: One of the ways for securing a computer network when a machine is infected with malware is to remove that machine from the network.

item.title: Nadella, Gates were against Microsoft-Nokia deal: Report
item.description: Microsoft founder Bill Gates and new CEO Satya Nadella were reportedly against the Nokia buyout, as were many other unnamed board members.

item.title: What drivers will do in driverless cars
item.description: Analysts expecting sales of self-driving, if not completely driverless, cars to begin taking off by the end of this decade.

item.title: What will drivers do in driverless cars
item.description: Analysts expecting sales of self-driving, if not completely driverless, cars to begin taking off by the end of this decade.

item.title: Apps thrill toddlers as Swedish schools go digital
item.description: In Sweden, like in many countries, small children often play games on tablets and laptops long before they encounter them at school.

item.title: Gmail app on iOS is now faster
item.description: Google has reportedly updated its Gmail app for iOS, finally addressing the loathsome speed of which users earlier complained about.

item.title: Silicon Valley investors welcome Indian talent
item.description: Companies such as Google and WhatsApp have Indian-origin engineers in top positions.

item.title: IBM helps Idea Cellular improve postpaid customer service
item.description: IBM has announced that Idea Cellular has leveraged the company’s business consulting expertise to transform its postpaid business.

item.title: Samsung launches India’s costliest Android tablet
item.description: Samsung has launched the Galaxy Note Pro tablet in India at a whopping Rs 65,575, making it the most expensive Android tablet in the country.

item.title: eBay corporate governance worst ever: Icahn
item.description: Billionaire activist investor Carl Icahn said that corporate governance at e-commerce giant eBay Inc was the worst he had ever seen.

item.title: Skype's web version now available worldwide
item.description: Microsoft has launched Skype for Outlook along with HD video calling for PC users.

item.title: Slowdown hurting smartphone chips supply: Imagination Tech
item.description: The British company said it had not been helped by its lower market share in cheaper smartphones.

item.title: Want to answer Nature's call? There's a website for it
item.description: Now, a new website is making it easier for tourists to get much needed relief when traveling in an unfamiliar city or town.

item.title: Want to answer Nature's call? There's a website for that
item.description: Now, a new website is making it easier for tourists to get much needed relief when traveling in an unfamiliar city or town.

item.title: Azoi launches Wello smartphone case at Rs 12,350
item.description: Wello includes sensors that can measure a number of key vitals including blood pressure, electrocardiography (ECG), and heart rate.

item.title: Internet is the new doctor
item.description: People want more than just information online, they also seek reflections, insights and practical advice from other patients.

item.title: Google: Mobile to create bigger advertising pie
item.description: Mobile devices such as smartphones and tablets will vastly expand the number of companies who advertise online.

item.title: Google Glass banned in California bar over recording fears
item.description: A San Francisco bar is banning Google Glass over concerns that the web-connected, head-mounted computer will be used to record customers.

item.title: Dial '1063' to register telcom complaints
item.description: Telecom subscribers across the country can now register complaints by dialling a special toll free number '1063'

item.title: Lessons from bitcoin exchange Mt. Gox's fall
item.description: Some of those who have lost bitcoins in collapse of Mt. Gox have turned to internet sleuthing to find out where their money has gone.

item.title: Facebook Messenger comes to Windows Phone
item.description: Windows Phone users would finally be able to have a dedicated Facebook Messenger app on their device as promised by Microsoft.

item.title: Apple desirable even as Android dominates in emerging markets: Report
item.description: Apple is seen as a more desirable brand in emerging markets where Android enjoys dominance, a new study has revealed.

item.title: Android may dominate, but Apple more desirable in emerging markets: Report
item.description: Apple is seen as a more desirable brand in emerging markets where Android enjoys dominance, a new study has revealed.
